result.markdown: --- title: Zak Varty about: template: solana links: - icon: twitter text: twitter href: "https://twitter.com/zakvarty" - icon: github text: Github href: "https://github.com/zakvarty" - icon: google text: Google Scholar href: "https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=3H4vg4cAAAAJ&hl=en&oi=ao" freeze: true --- :::{#hero-heading} ::: small_right ::: I am a __statistician__, __data scientist__ and __educator__. I develop statistical methodology and data science solutions to solve challenging data problems. I am particularly interested in modelling environmental and industrial processes. I work as a teaching fellow at **[Imperial College London](https://www.imperial.ac.uk/statistics)**. In my work, I lead courses and supervise research projects in statistics, data science and data ethics. Previously, I completed my PhD in Statistics and Operational Research within the **[STOR-i CDT](https://www.lancaster.ac.uk/stor-i/)** at **[Lancaster University](https://www.lancaster.ac.uk/maths/)**. My PhD work combined point process models with techniques from extreme value theory and Bayesian inference to model induced earthquake activity. When I am not in front of my computer, I enjoy distance running üèÉ and I love to read üìñ. Ideally, these activities are accompanied by a good cup of coffee and a large slice of cake. :::
